page.title: 05MEDIA
page.content: MEDIA WE LOOKED AT THE MAIN NEWS STORIES IN NORTHWICH FOR THE WEEK BEGINNING THE 6TH OF JUNE 1985. THE MAIN STORY CONCERNED SOCCER FANS FROM NORTHWICH WHO WERE RELIEVED TO GET HOME AFTER THE DISASTER IN BRUSSELS WHERE 38 PEOPLE WHERE KILLED AND HUNDREDS INJURED AFTER A EUROPEAN CUP RIOT. ANOTHER STORY INVOLVES THE CONTINUING PROBLEMS OF RAISING ENOUGH MONEY TO REPAIR THE ANDERTON BOAT LIFT. THIS PIECE OF INDUSTRIAL MACHINERY NEEDS RESTORING AND AT LAST THE BRITISH WATERWAYS BOARD HAS SET UP A WORK GROUP TO HELP FINANCE THE RESTORTION WORK.NEWSPAPER BOYS PEDALLED THEMSELVES INTO THE HEADLINES LAST WEEK. THE BOYS FROM GREENBANK WON FIRST PLACE IN A PEDAL-CAR COMPETITION AT THE NEARBY RACING TRACK AT OULTON PARK.
